introduction: Basics of Electrical Engineering Lab is a virtual laboratory designed to offer an interactive and engaging learning experience in the foundational principles of electrical engineering. This lab covers a wide array of core electrical concepts through a series of simulated experiments. Students will have the opportunity to explore fundamental circuits, investigate AC and DC networks, and delve into the characteristics of basic electrical components. By conducting these virtual experiments, students will gain practical experience, develop critical analytical and problem-solving skills, and reinforce their understanding of essential electrical engineering principles.

experiments.name: Measurement of power and power factor in a single-phase ac series inductive circuit and study improvement of power factor using capacitor
Connection and measurement of power consumption of a fluorescent lamp (tube light)
To study running and speed reversal of a three-phase induction motor and record speed in both directions
Demonstration of cut-out sections of machines: dc machine, three phase induction machine, single-phase induction machine and synchronous machine
Measurement of Operational Amplifier Parameters: Common Mode Gain, Differential Mode Gain, CMRR, Slew Rate
To plot V-I characteristics of SCR
To plot V-I characteristics of TRIAC
Calibration of AC voltmeter and AC ammeter
Verification of Superposition and Thevenin Theorem

UG: 3rd Year/ 4th Year [next higher priority for development]

objective: The primary objective of Basics of Electrical Engineering Lab is to provide students with a comprehensive and engaging learning experience in fundamental electrical engineering. Through interactive simulations of real-world laboratory experiments, the lab aims to enhance conceptual understanding, develop experimental skills, foster critical thinking, and promote independent learning in the field of electrical engineering

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: Delhi Technical University; AP101; B. Tech : Electrical Engineering
Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University; ETPH 103; B. Tech
NIT Calicut; PH1002; B. Tech : Electrical
